poem:
Title: In Absence of Her Story

On silver's screen, a void lays bare,
Just 30 of a hundred share,
Their stories told, their voices few,
To cinema, their essence withdrew.

Hollywood's lights, they blend and blur,
A homogenous, masculine slur.
Silent, she waits behind the gauzy haze,
Invisible in the scripted maze. 

Eclipsed in film's demanding gloam,
Find her, lift her, bring her home.
